alert.note: Alert for Macon (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 7:36AM EST until February 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...Western Macon County. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 AM EST, After 4 to 5 inches of storm total rainfall, excessive runoff continued throughout the Nantahala River basin. Be wary of flooding of low-lying areas and low-water crossings into this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nantahala Lake, Rainbow Springs, Wayah Bald, Aquone and Kyle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
